Name: Model of a boat
Description: This wooden model comes from a tomb at Antinoopolis and is a fine example of a ship of papyrus stems bound together at the stern. The hull has been decorated with zigzag motifs. The crew consists of four rowers, an overseer sitting on the stern, and a depth sounder standing with outstretched arm on the prow. The owner of the vessel is standing with upraised left arm between the rowers, who are seated in pairs in the middle of the ship. The ship was undoubtedly made for a funerary context and symbolises the mobility of the deceased in the underworld.
